intro: Lavoisiera confertiflora var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-flowered lavoisiera, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescence, typical of the carrot family. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are usually pinnately divided, with a slightly hairy texture. This variety is native to certain regions of South America and is often found in moist, temperate habitats.
